item.description: I’m a software engineer and synthetic biologist with a firm belief in building from first principles . My goal is to develop systems and tools to engineer living systems from scratch. I study Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, and Bioengineering at Berkeley. I currently work for an awesome company called Asimov , developing software to build genetic circuits for mammalian cell lines. My interests vary, but I’m currently reading about or working on projects relating to:

item.title: Bioware index
item.description: A simple tool to catalog biological labware.

item.title: Enzyme classification using CNNs
item.description: Classifying enzyme catalytic activity with neural networks.

item.title: Gene alignment application
item.description: A minimal application for gene alignment built from scratch.

item.title: Genomic sequencing pipeline
item.description: Automated analytics and screening of sequencing data.

item.title: Novel strain of E. coli
item.description: Used canonical synthetic biology techniques to engineer a small library of bacterial strains.

item.title: On Writing
item.description: Lets see how strong this idea really is.

item.title: Research
item.description: Tijana Radivojević et al. ART: A machine learning Automated Recommendation Tool for synthetic biology Presentations A brief overview of Machine Learning and its application to Metabolic Engineering “Techniques for the purification of murine norovirus glycan binding domains” Advancing Wet and Dry Lab Tools to Accelerate the BioFoundry Design-Build Process “TOP-10cc: a streamlined cloning system with inducible copy-control” “Analysis of LOXL2 Mediated Regulation of the SPTBN1 Gene in Human Gingival Fibroblasts”
